One last thing to keep in mind is that you also have to define the end point of your game. In the case of this Tutorial it's the page TEnd, which you'll see in action when you click on the button, *Go to your games*, below. It essentially works like a normal page, except for two things: first, in the `page.json` the value for the variable *endOfTopic* is *true*; and, second, there is no **pageTransition** file. This means that the *buttonText* below is generated by your change to the **page** file; and it will take you back to the *Your games* page, where your game will be listed under *Finished Games* (and where you can download your Notebook as a PDF).

If you're interested in the complete functionality of *Marugoto*, be sure to check out the writers' guide (under development). If you find bugs or errors, pull requests are always welcome (see our “Bug Bounty Programme” on the LiT frontpage). Please be in touch via via GitHub or Twitter.

That's it! Now you should be able to start creating your own *Lives in Transit* game. Good luck, and have fun!
